author: ghost
body:
```
PS /> [System.Text.Encoding]::GetEncoding(932)                                                                       
Exception calling "GetEncoding" with "1" argument(s): "No data is available for encoding 932. For information on 
defining a custom encoding, see the documentation for the Encoding.RegisterProvider method."
At line:1 char:1
+ [System.Text.Encoding]::GetEncoding(932)
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], MethodInvocationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NotSupportedException
```

Is it possible to get CodePage information through LC environment variable?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
This is a .Net API, you should look through their issues and if it's not known, open a new one:

https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/search?q=GetEncoding&type=Issues&utf8=%E2%9C%93

comments.author: ghost
comments.body:
Ah, ok now I understood.

Here is some info: https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsapps/en-US/9c6cbef9-aa41-47bd-9c2d-a49f0952a545/encodingregisterprovider-how-to-use?forum=wpdevelop

What I figured out is: I tested same PS code on Windows 8.1, which didn't require EncodingRegisterProvider. Now .NET for PowerShell is newer than it, so it requires loading it.

title: No data is available for encoding 932
